Life Hacks for Your Family’s Health & Wealth

Learn the top life hacks for your pocketbook and family. We’ll cover being a college savvy parent positioning your child for maximum financial aid and offers; optimizing you or your parent’s Social Security benefits; and angles on how to best protect your family. Then, we’re bringing in an authority on all things health related: energy, weight loss, stress release, sleep and more. She was on the Today Show and we’re bringing her to you to hear her quick natural fixes.

Warning: Fun swag will be handed out.
 
RSVP to Nora Yousif below or at (508) 230-8960

Putting Your Best Foot (in cute heels) Forward

Learn what you ought to pay attention to when it comes to your finances and what common financial and investment mistakes to avoid. Next, learn how to best market yourself from the woman who literally wrote the book on personal branding. Learn how to position yourself effectively for your career and how to brand yourself even when you are off the clock. Lastly, we’ll have a stylist in to keep you looking fab in the midst of the winter drab.

 

RSVP to Nora Yousif below or at (508) 230-8960

Massachusetts Millionaire-ess: Say and do the right things

Learn responsible money mindset guidelines to teach your family. If you’ve “arrived,” learn how to best sustain your wealth for generations to come. We’ll also be joined by the talented, Emmy Award-winning journalist and former Channel 5 news anchor, Heather Unruh. She’ll offer us tips on being heard and how to communicate most effectively in all facets of your life.

 

RSVP to Nora Yousif below or at (508) 230-8960  RBC Wealth Managment is not affiliated with Heather Unruh.

Event Title: Green Investment Club – Investing for Positive Social Impact
Description: The Green Investment Club meets 6 times a year to discuss investments with a positive social impact which meet ESG screening criteria. Using “ESG” criteria involves judging companies and investments based their environmental impact, social diversity policies, and their responsiveness to feedback from stakeholders. The Club has existed for 10 years and we welcome anyone who has an interest in socially-conscious investing to come check us out. You are invited to contact Jeff for more information. No drop-ins please. You must speak to Jeff or a Club member before attending a meeting.

You are cordially invited to an educational seminar on Long-Term Care for Women


You’ve saved for your retirement since you started working. You did everything right: opened a 401(k), started an IRA, and even “pinched your pennies.” But have you thought about the cost of living in some sort of long-term care facility? It’s no secret that healthcare costs are on the rise. Planning for a stay, even if it’s a short one, in a medical facility is not only wise but critical to your retirement. Join us as we discuss different ways to save and plan for this event.

Event Title: An evening with Carlotta Walls LaNier
Description:
Carlotta Walls LaNier—the youngest of the courageous African-American students known as the Little Rock Nine who integrated Arkansas’ Little Rock Central High School in 1957. An iconic figure in our American history and civil rights movement whose path is documented in the book A Mighty Long Way…My Journey to Justice at Little Rock Central High, we’re incredibly honored to have her as our special guest to share a small portion of her story with you.

Understanding that everyone’s path to success is different, we hope that you’ll plan to join us as we learn together from Carlotta Walls-LaNier and her historic journey. Please email sheena.nikolaus@rbc.com or click the button below to RSVP.

Event Title: The Will and Lobo Wealth Management Group: Retirement Seminar ONE
Description:
Rewriting Retirement: Write your own retirement story. Baby boomers have redefined every life phase, and retirement is no different. As 10,000 Boomers retire daily, the landscape is shifting away from stereotypes of the past to an exciting life phase defined by new perspectives around retirement and aging.

Exploring the opportunities and challenges of today’s retirement.

In this one-hour seminar, we’ll explore both the opportunities and challenges of today’s retirement. To start, we’ll address important retirement planning questions, including:

  • How much money will I need?
  • Where will it come from?
  • How long will it last?

Life in Retirement beyond the numbers. Planning for retirement means more than just the numbers. An RBC WealthPlan enables you to set a course, define milestones and track progress toward your goals. This seminar is an opportunity to obtain more retirement clarity and increased confidence in your future.

Have you ever been Curling?

Neither have we. That is why Lee and I are looking forward to getting together with you on the ice. No need to be bashful. We can’t wait to welcome you, your spouse, or any other guest you might like to have come out. We call it the “Curling Dare” for good reason. It’s new to almost anyone we have spoken with thus far. With that being said, it is our goal to get you out there, so we dare you to try something new with us!

 

RSVP as soon as possible so we can get the count of who will be able to make it for our preparations. Let’s go have some fun!

 

Cheers,

Lee & Chris

Event Title: Green Investment Club – Investing for Positive Social Impact
Description: The Green Investment Club meets 6 times a year to discuss investments with a positive social impact which meet ESG screening criteria. Using “ESG” criteria involves judging companies and investments based their environmental impact, social diversity policies, and their responsiveness to feedback from stakeholders. The Club has existed for 10 years and we welcome anyone who has an interest in socially-conscious investing to come check us out. You are invited to contact Jeff for more information. No drop-ins please. You must speak to Jeff or a Club member before attending a meeting.

Event Title: Maximize Your Roth - How to use your 401(k) to increase tax-free growth
Description:
This 30 minute presentation will cover after tax retirement plan contributions and how to turn them into Roth assets. This educational discussion is best suited for individuals who:

• Are high income earners who no longer qualify for Roth IRA’s

• Typically max out their retirement plan contributions

• Are concerned about taxes in retirement

• Want to build tax free assets

Hosted by:

MLA Wealth Management Group RBC Wealth Management

Event Title: How prepared are you to live well in retirement?
Description:
MIT AgeLab has identified three simple questions you should ask yourself to assess how prepared you are to live well in retirement.

  • Who will change my light bulbs?
  • How will I get an ice cream cone?
  • Who will I have lunch with?

What do these questions have to do with retirement planning? A lot more than you may think. They actually uncover important factors that will determine your future quality of life and serve as a starting point for planning a satisfying retirement. The Droster Team invites you and your loved ones to join us and start the conversation. 

RSVP by March 10 to Alex at (608) 252-7504 or alexandra.maas@rbc.com.

Event Title: Stonebridge Group Alternative Investments Dinner with Owl Rock
Description:
Please join us for dinner at Al Biernat’s North. We will be discussing Alternative Investments and the current offering in the Owl Rock Technology Finance Corp. Our guest speaker will be Craig Nelson, Vice President with Owl Rock.

  • Owl Rock is a leading alternative asset manager founded by Doug Ostrover, Marc Lipschultz and Craig Packer, who previously held senior executive roles at GSO/Blackstone, KKR, and Goldman Sachs. Each have spent over 25 years building successful credit, underwriting and alternative investment businesses.
     
  • In partnership with financial sponsors, companies and management teams, Owl Rock can lead or anchor highly customized financings across a variety of industries. Owl Rock provides investors with access to alternative investment strategies that offer the potential to generate income and attractive risk-adjusted returns.

Event Title: 8,000 Days - An Entire Phase of Life Waiting to be Invented

Event Title: Investing now for tomorrow's retirement income
Description:
John Larsen and Rachel Panasuk of the Larsen Group cordially invites you to join us for an educational presentation

An essential part of planning a healthy financial future includes both a dividend growth approach to investing and addressing economic downturns. Rick Novak, a veteran portfolio analyst on the Portfolio Advisory Group team at RBC Wealth Management will discuss the important benefits of a dividend growth and capital appreciation investment strategy.

In addition, The Larsen Group has incorporated Clearbridge’s unique and innovative U.S. Recession Risk Indicators into their daily practice. Bayley Davis, Managing Director – Client Portfolio Manager at Clearbridge Investments will discuss the importance of using the indicators as a means to determine current market conditions as expansionary, cautionary or possible risk of the next recession.

Planning for a happy and healthy retirement goes beyond just saving and investing; it requires you to navigate a progressively complex landscape and make informed decisions along the way. One of the most critical decisions to make is how you will pay for health care once you’ve left the workforce.

 

What once was a matter of a few years, life in retirement now can span decades thanks to advances in medical treatments and technologies that enable us to live longer. While this is good news, determining the cost of health care over an increasingly longer span of time can be a challenge—and one that most people aren’t sure how to tackle.

 

At RBC Wealth Management, we are devoted to bringing clarity and confidence to your everyday lives through meaningful planning combined with expert guidance along the way. Talk to your financial advisor about your RBC WealthPlan and the important role health care plays in your financial future.

Event Title: Covering your assets: How to keep what you've got
Description:
Covering your assets: How to keep what you’ve got

Congratulations! You have achieved the "American Dream." You've managed through sheer will, hard work, intelligence, and perseverance to accumulate significant net worth. However, there is increasingly a gathering storm of forces working to compromise personal wealth. It is causing many people to wonder, "Will I be OK?" "Will my family be OK?" "Will my business survive to be sold or passed down later on?"

At this presentation, you will learn:

· Examples of the myths, errors, illusions, and delusions that can trip up investors.

· How to organize an entire estate so that you can enjoy your assets during life, but pass them on as you wish after death.

· How to defend the wealth that you have worked so hard to achieve in a world more complex and perilous than ever before.

Wealthy, Healthy and Wise
A Women's Empowerment Forum


Location:

Eau Palm Beach Resort & Spa

100 S. Ocean Blvd | Manalapan, FL 33462


Date:
Friday, February 6th, 2015

• 35% of Americans say nobody taught them about investing.
  • 25% of American parents admit they haven’t done a good job preparing their children to manage money or manage their money for their child.

Is teaching your children how to manage their money and make smart investment decisions on your to-do list? Join us at Migration Brewing as we look over some of the basic building blocks for financial success, including:

  •  Managing debt levels
  • Time value of money
  • Maximizing an employer’s 401k plan
  • Investing for planned educational expenses
  • Einstein’s 8th "Wonder of the World": Compound Interest
  • And more!

We are encouraging parents to bring their kids along for the presentation, to allow our team to help field any questions that might arise throughout the material.

Space will be limited, so please RSVP below if you wish to attend.

Starting to take the reins in helping and caring for parents can be overwhelming...

Do you know the number one priority when caring for your aging parents? What happens when an elderly parent needs caregiving? How do you coordinate efforts and find resources from near and afar?

Come join our team and featured guest speaker, local attorney Leanne M. Bowker, to learn the answers to these questions and many more.

Discover the Four Keys to address in caring for your aging parents and gain valuable tips and resources for putting together a well thought-out plan. This presentation is going to be packed full of resources you won’t want to miss!

Come get your retirement rundown on tap. We’ll cover the big retirement mistakes to avoid, while helping you optimize your lifetime Social Security benefit check, all while you kick back a few locally-brewed cold ones.

This quarter’s legislative update will cover a number of items, including an update on the SECURE Act, which is now being considered by the Senate, the recently released hardship withdrawal regulations, and updates on new rules for electronic participant disclosures.

About the presenter:

Patrick McKiernan, C(k)P® has 25 years experience in the area of retirement plan consulting. He is a member of the Government Affairs Committee of the National Association of Plan Advisors (NAPA) and serves as a NAPA delegate in Washington, D.C., to discuss the retirement plan industry with policy makers. He has been a speaker and contributor to Association for Legal Administrators events and journals and also serves on the Retirement Advisor Council, a national organization that advocates for successful qualified plan and participant outcomes.

Guest speaker: Anthony L. Scialabba, Esq. Anthony is the Managing Member at The Law Firm of Anthony L. Scialabba, LLC. In addition, he serves as the President and the Chief Executive Officer of RetireWell Administrators, Inc., a retirement and executive compensation administration firm. Mr. Scialabba has over 30 years of experience in employee benefits law and over 20 years of experience in third-party plan administration and has published 70 articles on employee benefit topics

Topics of discussion:

• DOL/ERISA Law – A Washington update

• Protecting retirement plan fiduciaries from ERISA liability

• Creative plan designs for DB/DC plans and fixed for broken plans

• Cyber security for retirement plans

• What’s reasonable? Practical tips for evaluating fees and expenses of plan investments

Event Title: Women, Wealth & Why Now - Lunch and Networking Event
Description:
Join me as I welcome Jackie Wilke of First Trust for a fun and informative lunch time event on Monday, November 11, 2019. Lunch provided by The Olive Tree of Charleston beginning at noon. Doors open at 11:00 for fun conversation and networking. Jackie will provide an interactive presentation focusing on women and wealth.

Women play an integral role in influencing and building wealth – whether as heads of households, in corporations, as business owners,
estate executors, mothers, heirs and more. However, as a gender, they may have to overcome a lack of confidence in financial literacy and

decision making compared to their male counterparts. No matter where your finance acumen is currently, this presentation breaks down
the world of wealth as it relates to key topics such as investing, goals based planning, wealth management, working with the right
professionals and why everyone needs to be involved in the conversation

Event Title: 2020 WebEx Series: Budgeting for the New Year
Description: How to get back on track after the holidays.

Alisha Wesser, CFP® from the Plan Resource Group will be reviewing helpful information on the CARES Act. The federal government has passed legislation to help Americans in a variety of ways from stimulus checks, unemployment changes, student loan payment delays and retirement plan withdrawal options.

As we continue to progress through this difficult time more information will become available. We want to provide you with the most up to date, reliable and understandable information.

Description: Test

The U.S. stock market has been in existence for roughly 200 years. Over that long period of time, it has consistently moved higher, but NEVER in a straight line. A “buy and hold” approach is often successful for long term investors, but are there alternative strategies with potential to protect against the major, but inevitable, stock market declines? Event Title: Living longer, healthier lives requires good planning
Description:
This seminar reviews Social Security benefits and strategies, Medicare basics, and how the new SECURE Act may impact your retirement savings.Join us for a vibrant discussion with our guest speakers Kurt Czarnowski, Social Security and Medicare expert, and Certified Public Accountant Lillian Gonzalez, who will discuss taxation on your benefits in your retirement.
• Social Security benefits help provide a foundation for your retirement income needs. We’ll review various strategies
for claiming, delaying or suspending your benefits.
• Medicare has different components that help cover specific services. We’ll navigate through the different parts and review options for filling in the gaps.
• 2019’s SECURE Act will provide opportunities to investors saving for their retirements. We’ll illustrate how these recent changes may impact you.

Event Title: Imagine 2025: A look at Disruptive Innovations and a 2020 Market Outlook Update
Description:
The U.S. economy is returning to slower growth, but innovation speeds on. What will be the global drivers
for parabolic change over the next decade? In this speaking series, Vice President – Senior Portfolio Advisor at RBC Wealth Management, Lindsay Strickland,
will contextually explore how innovations like 5G, Internet of Things, global payments, genomics and automation may help investors find longer-term growth trends going forward.
Our second guest speaker, Senior Portfolio Manager, Global Asset Allocation at Columbia Threadneedle Investments, Anwiti Bahuguna, will share her thoughts on the sources of likely volatility in 2020, the global
economy and financial markets.

Event Title: Rewriting Retirement: Thriving in your Encore Years
Description:
Today, the face of retirement is changing as medical advances stretch lifespans and deliver longer and healthier lives filled with increased vitality. This evolution requires a reassessment of expectations and concerns for those preparing, entering and living in retirement. While financial concerns remain vital, additional considerations like quality of life, personal fulfillment and the ability to manage risk are moving to the forefront.
Our presentation pertains to thriving in your encore years. Our goal is to inspire attendees to create retirement goals and consider a retirement plan to assist them over time.

Event Title: State of the Markets, Monetary and Fiscal Stimulus and Opportunities for Investors in our New Normal:
Description:
The U.S. economy is on track to show the biggest contraction in the second quarter in American history. The federal government has tried to prop up the economy to cope with an unprecedented cataclysm. Washington has already passed $2.3 trillion in relief for households and businesses. When we finally enter into the post-crisis period, the business and economic context will likely not have returned to its pre-crisis state. The business landscape has changed fundamentally; we think tomorrow’s environment will be different, but no less rich in possibilities for those who are prepared.

Join us for a conversation with RBC’s Senior Portfolio Advisor, Vice President, Lindsay Strickland as we review the markets and contextually explore how innovations like Internet of Things, Global Payments, AI, Genomics, Robotics and Automation may help investors find longer term growth opportunities.

Base Camp: PNNL Retirement 101

We will cover the following topics:

  • Learn which pension option is best for you and your family
  • Learn about social security strategies for your family
  • Learn what to do with your 401(k) plan at retirement
  • Learn about retiree health care options

We will be covering the topic via a LIVE virtual WebEx link. You will be able to listen to Kyle Blodgett, Certified Financial Planner ®, present and follow along as he shares the PowerPoint presentation with you.

Event Title: Virtual Meeting  - The Psychology of Investing  Presenting:  BlackRock
Description:
During a time of market turbulence and mounting uncertainty about the length of this pandemic we are often concerned about our financial health. History tells us that we will always have a recovery and that the best offense is a good defense. An Investor needs to hold the line.

Please join us for a special virtual WebEx conference with David Babat, Vice President, Blackrock Inc. He will discuss why long term investing is the key to success regardless of the current economic environment and what is driving short term market turbulence.

Event Title: Planning your Legacy : When to use a Will, a Trust, or a Power of Attorney
Description:
Having estate planning discussions now, will help assure your wishes for loved ones and charitable causes are in place. Our discussion will include estate planning strategies.

  • Reduce your taxable estate and transfer more of your assets to what you care about most.
  • Avoid probate costs
  • Help ease your loved ones' difficulties during their time of grief by planning ahead.
  • Plan accordingly so that your assets are distributed according to your wishes. A question and answer will follow.

100 years ago, the 19th Amendment was ratified guaranteeing all American Women the right to vote.  And since then we have seen immense improvements in equal rights and opportunities and greater personal freedom for women.  But despite all of these advances, financial literacy continues to be a challenge for a lot of us.

 

Please join us on Thursday, September 10th from 4:30-5:30 PM (ET) for a presentation designed specifically for women.  In this presentation, we will focus on three goals:

  • Empower – Illustrate how women represent a growing economic driver
  • Elevate – Expand awareness of key considerations, such as health care, longevity, and investing for the future
  • Achieve – Provide strategies to help women achieve short- and long-term goals

Learn more about the event here.

Event Title: Cybersecurity: Protecting yourself from criminals, hackers and thieves
Description: Join us for an exciting discussion on cybercrime and cybersecurity with our keynote speakers. Learn practical ways to protect yourself and your family from identity theft, fraud and cybercrime. As cyber threats grow more sophisticated, private and public spending may create potential opportunities for investors. Enterprise and security budgets are trending up to protect global digitization, data-driven innovative technologies and cloud enterprise IT from attacks by cybercriminals. Our speakers will share ways for investors to add exposure to cybersecurity to their investment portfolios.

Event Title: Imagine 2025: A look at Disruptive Innovations and a 2020 Market Outlook Update
Description:
The U.S. economy is returning to slower growth, but innovation speeds on. What will be the global drivers for parabolic change over the next decade? In this speaking series, Vice President – Senior Portfolio Advisor at RBC Wealth Management, Lindsay Strickland, will contextually explore how innovations like 5G, Internet of Things, global payments, genomics and automation may help investors find longer-term growth trends going forward.

Our second guest speaker, Senior Portfolio Manager, Global Asset Allocation at Columbia Threadneedle Investments, Anwiti Bahuguna, will share her thoughts on the sources of likely volatility in 2020, the global economy and financial markets.

Event Title: State of the Markets, Monetary and Fiscal Stimulus and Opportunities for Investors in our New Normal:
Description:
The U.S. economy is on track to show the biggest contraction in the second quarter in American history. The federal government has tried to prop up the economy to cope with an unprecedented cataclysm. Washington has already passed $2.3 trillion in relief for households and businesses. When we finally enter into the post-crisis period, the business and economic context will likely not have returned to its pre-crisis state. The business landscape has changed fundamentally; we think tomorrow’s environment will be different, but no less rich in possibilities for those who are prepared.

Join us for a conversation with RBC’s Senior Portfolio Advisor, Vice President, Lindsay Strickland as we review the markets and contextually explore how innovations like Internet of Things, Global Payments, AI, Genomics, Robotics and Automation may help investors find longer term growth opportunities.

Event Title: Living longer, healthier lives requires good planning
Description:
This seminar reviews Social Security benefits and strategies, Medicare basics, and how the new SECURE Act may impact your retirement savings.Join us for a vibrant discussion with our guest speakers Kurt Czarnowski, Social Security and Medicare expert, and Certified Public Accountant Lillian Gonzalez, who will discuss taxation on your benefits in your retirement.

  • Social Security benefits help provide a foundation for your retirement income needs. We’ll review various strategies for claiming, delaying or suspending your benefits.
  • Medicare has different components that help cover specific services. We’ll navigate through the different parts and review options for filling in the gaps.
  • 2019’s SECURE Act will provide opportunities to investors saving for their retirements. We’ll illustrate how these recent changes may impact you.
test

Guest speaker: Alan Robinson Global Portfolio Analyst, RBC Wealth Management

Alan is a 25+ year veteran of the financial markets and previously worked in London and Hong Kong, where he traded currency and credit derivatives. He joined RBC Wealth Management in 2006 and now guides investments for the firm’s tactical, income and ADR portfolios. Alan speaks on a wide range of global issues, including international investing, currencies and broad market commentary. He has a Bachelor of Science degree in physics from Imperial College, London, and an MBA from the University of Washington.

  • Learn which pension option is best for you and your family
  • Learn about social security strategies for your family
  • Learn what to do with your 401(k) plan at retirement
  • Learn about retiree health care options

Join as we cover this topic via a LIVE virtual WebEx link.

Please RSVP by email using the link below.

We will email you a link to join the WebEx presentation prior to the start of the event.

An Educational Course for Adults - Ages 50 to 70

Traditionally conducted at Hanford High School. Now being offered online and at The Pacific Crest Planning Learning Center.

  • In-person class: Thursdays, March 18 & 25 | 6:30 p.m. to 9:30 p.m.
  • Online class: Tuesdays, March 23 & 30 | 6:30 p.m. to 8:30 p.m.

Learn how to:

  • Determine the amount of money you need to retire
  • Create your own goals for a "successful retirement"
  • Eliminate debt and improve cash flow
  • Properly convert your IRA to a Roth IRA
  • Select the retirement plan distribution choice that is right for you
  • Plan your retirement income to preserve a comfortable standard of living
  • Transfer the risk of potential financial losses before or during retirement
  • Reduce or eliminate taxes, expenses, delays and legal challenges with estate planning

Learn how to maximize your ‘inside the fence’ benefits. This information will be valuable for anyone who plans on retiring from the Hanford Site, regardless of whether you are covered by Operations & Engineering, or HAMTC.

We will be covering the following topics:

  • Learn about pension options for you and your family
  • Learn about social security strategies for your family
  • Learn what to do with your 401(k) plan at retirement
  • Learn about retiree health care options

Event Title: WebEx presentation on Medicare: Age 65, a Milestone Year…
Description:
Medicare is a U.S. government program providing health insurance for people age 65 and older. Medicare coverage can be a confusing topic with an alphabet soup of options. Understanding Medicare’s costs to you, as well as its coverage, limits and gaps, is crucial to managing health care expenses throughout your retirement. Join us as we map out your options and highlight key considerations for sound medical coverage planning.

Presented by:

Gabrielle Clemens, JD, LLM, CDFA®, AEP® I Managing Director - Wealth Advisor

Lisa M Austin, Chartered SRI Counselor™, AAMS | First Vice President – Wealth Advisor

This is a WebEx Presentation. A WebEx invitation will be emailed to our RSVP’d Guests.

Event Title: WebEx presentation: Prioritizing planning helps families manage financial risks of Alzheimer’s and dementia
Description:
Caring for someone with cognitive decline is a long, stressful, emotional journey. There are also significant—and unexpected—financial impacts on caregivers. Join us as we explore how cognitive decline can have devastating impacts not just on those diagnosed with the disease, but on their caregivers as well. We’ll provide actionable ideas for helping you prepare the expected on your journey forward.

Description:
On February 25th, Aaron Felix from our WMO product team will join us for an in-depth walk-through of our redesigned website and its new features. If you are a frequent user of WMO, or occasionally pop onto the site to find a statement or balance, you've noticed a big change. Let us help you navigate the platform to quickly find the information most important to you! 

Some new features on the WMO site:

COVID has been a game changer, and Edgcomb Financial Advisors is fully ditigal. With all this change, we recognize that uncertainty is off the charts. Thus, we are committed to bringing you perspectives that cut through the endless noise in our digital world.

Join us for a market outlook featuring:

Chris Peterson, CFA | Senior Vice President - Head of the Strategy Research Group

Chris is a Senior Vice President and head of the Strategy Research Group. In this role he is responsible for developing and implementing quantitative equity investment strategies. Chris is also a member of the Investment Committee. He has over 22 years of experience in the financial services industry, the last 20 with First Trust.

He has a BS in Finance from Bradley University and an MBA from the University of Chicago Booth School of Business. Additionally, Chris holds the Chartered Financial Analyst designation (CFA) and is a member of the CFA Institute and CFA Society of Chicago.

Event Title: The Unexpected Power of Selflessness by Richard Lui, News Anchor, MSNBC
Description:
In light of the continuing turmoil in the world, we are hosting a conference call on Thursday 04/01/2021 at 4:30 PM (EST) with Richard Lui, News Anchor, MSNBC. The purpose of the call is to discuss his recent book Enough About Me, The Unexpected Power of Selflessness, where he discusses being selfless and a caregiver for your family in times of difficulty. The book mixes personal stories with research and tips on how and why living selflessly can bring joy despite difficulty. It also contrasts findings from Richard’s recent reporting with behind-the-scenes stories of heroes who rose above to be helpful, self-sacrificing and generous in the face of tragedy and loss, showing us all how small acts and choices can put a stop to our Selfish Pandemic.

Event Title: Credit Solutions During the Covid-19 Pandemic by Trish Chambers, Senior Vice President, Private Banker, City National Bank
Description:
In light of the continuing turmoil in the world, we are hosting a conference call on Thursday 04/08/2021 at 4:30 PM (EST) with Trish Chambers, Senior Vice President, Private Banker, City National Bank. The purpose of the call is to discuss credit solutions during the Covid-19 pandemic.

Trish Chambers is a senior vice president and private banker with City National’s Private Banking team. She advises high-net-worth families and non-profits on comprehensive wealth management strategies and private banking solutions. Prior to joining City National, Ms. Chambers was a wealth advisor and senior vice president for Wells Fargo in the NY Private Bank. Her 25 years in the private banking industry include such institutions as HSBC, Citibank and Modern Bank, a start-up boutique private bank. She began her career as a corporate lender at Chase upon completing the Credit Training Program.

Ms. Chambers earned her bachelor’s degree from Williams College and her Master of Business Administration in finance from the Stern School of Business at NYU. She has passed the Series 7 and 66 securities exams. She is a member of the NY Community Trust’s Women’s Advisory Council and co-chair of the Philanthropy Committee of City National Bank’s NY Women’s Network.

Event Title: Matrimonial and Family Law and Estate Planning by Marilyn Chinitz, Partner and Sean Weissbart, Partner, Blank Rome
Description:
In light of the continuing turmoil in the world, we are hosting a conference call on Thursday 04/15/2021 at 4:30 PM (EST) with Marilyn Chinitz, Partner, Blank Rome and Sean Weissbart, Partner, Blank Rome. The purpose of the call is to discuss matrimonial and family law and estate planning during the Covid-19 pandemic.

Marilyn Chinitz is a formidable advocate for her clients, guiding them through some of the most challenging transitions in their lives. She concentrates her practice in matrimonial law, particularly high-net-worth divorce actions. Marilyn is a skillful negotiator whose numerous high-profile and celebrity cases have received national and international attention. She has more than 35 years of experience in every facet of family law, including: Complex divorce actions involving diverse transactional matters High-conflict custody cases, International custody cases including the return of abducted children in proceedings filed under the Hague Convention, Premarital agreements and postnuptial agreements, Same-sex divorce and Paternity cases.

Known for her straightforward, creative, and responsive approach to representing her clients, Marilyn is as successful in litigation as in settlement negotiations. She has argued winning appeals in the appellate courts of New York, and in trials before the family court and the supreme courts of New York. When high-profile marital matters or recent changes in the law make headlines, Marilyn is a sought-after commentator. She is often quoted in print, and has appeared on local and national television and radio shows including: NBC’s The Today Show, ABC News 20/20, Inside Edition, HLN’s Headline News and Hollywood Heat.

Sean R. Weissbart concentrates his practice in the areas of trusts and estates law and tax-exempt organizations. His trusts and estates practice is focused on domestic and international estate planning, the administration of trusts and estates, and the representation of beneficiaries and fiduciaries in contested matters in Surrogate’s Court. He also advises clients on the preparation of pre- and post-nuptial agreements and the modification of trusts upon divorce. Sean also counsels tax-exempt organizations on matters ranging from formation and obtaining of tax-exempt status from the Internal Revenue Service (“IRS”) to complying with state and federal tax-exemption laws and the avoidance of excise taxes and the unrelated business income tax. He has also litigated against the IRS in United States federal courts.

Sean serves as an adjunct professor of law at both New York University School of Law, where he teaches Income Taxation of Trusts and Estates and International Estate Planning, and Fordham University School of Law, where he teaches Trusts and Estates Drafting. He is a co-author of the law school textbook The Income Taxation of Trusts and Estates. He is a regular faculty member of leading trusts and estates conferences, including the Hawaii Tax Institute, the Notre Dame Tax and Estate Planning Institute, and the annual meeting of the New York State Bar Association. Sean publishes scholarly and practice-driven articles that have been featured in leading journals such as The ACTEC Law Journal, The Journal of Taxation, and Estate Planning. During law school, Sean served on the editorial board for the Fordham Law Review.

Please RSVP to Touba Alipour at touba.alipour@rbc.com or Jesus Medina at jesus.medina@rbc.com ,so we can share any research related to the topics discussed during the call.

Event Title: Base Camp: Hanford Pension Options - Annuity vs Lump Sum
Description:
If you are Hanford area worker, or know someone who is, this virtual event is for you!

Many people on the verge of retirement will be forced to make a decision about their pension that is irrevocable. They will be asked whether they want to take their pension benefit(s) in the form of a lump sum payment or monthly payments for the rest of their life and/or their spouse’s life. If that isn’t complicated enough, if one is inclined to choose the annuity, there are many forms of the annuity: Straight Life Annuity, Joint and Survivor, or Period Certain.

With so many considerations, where does one begin?

  • Are you worried about outliving your money?
  • Are you worried about inflation eroding the purchasing power of your pension payment?
  • Does your family need spousal benefit?
  • Are you comfortable investing? If so, how much risk does one take?
  • Are you a big spender? Do you need a governor on your spending?
  • Do you need the money? Is your retirement income covered from other resources?
  • What is the financial state of the pension?
  • Do you prefer simplicity in your wealth planning, or are you comfortable with a little more complexity if there are benefits?

As one can see, this decision is potentially complex and certainly individual to each person. As we enter 2021, this decision will also be affected by the significant decrease in interest rates in 2020. A decrease in interest rates will, generally, require pension funds to reserve larger lump sums for participants in order to protect the required annuity payments. This can make the lump sum more appealing in some cases.

But, which option is correct for your financial plan?

Should you, or someone you know, have questions about their pension, or which option to take, our Base Camp event on April 22nd will be a great place to start to learn more information about this decision.

Join as we cover this topic via a LIVE virtual WebEx link.

Event Title: Elder Care and Long Term Care During Covid-19 by Andrea Schanker, Partner, Schanker and Hochberg P.C and Jim Aronson, Insurance Designs Corporation, LLC
Description:
In light of the continuing turmoil in the world, we are hosting a conference call on Thursday 04/22/2021 at 4:30 PM (EST) with Andrea Schanker, Partner, Schanker and Hochberg P.C and Jim Aronson, Insurance Designs Corporation, LLC. The purpose of the call is to discuss Elder Care and Long term Care During the Covid-19 pandemic.

 

Andrea B. Schanker, Esq. – Partner, received her Bachelor of Arts degree in Clinical Psychology from University of Rochester in 1999 and her Juris Doctor from New York Law School in 2002. Andrea is a licensed member of the New York and New Jersey Bar Associations. She is the 2016-2017 President of the Huntington Lawyers’ Club, a member of the Suffolk County Bar Association and a member of the New York State Bar Association where she is an active member within the Trusts and Estates Section and the Elder Law and Special Needs Section. Ms. Schanker is also a member of the Suffolk County Bar Association and the American Bar Association.

 

Ms. Schanker joined Schanker and Hochberg P.C., in 2004 as an Associate Attorney specializing in Estate Planning, Estate Administration, Business Succession Planning, and Elder Law. She regularly delivers Estate Planning presentations to professionals in the financial industry and their clients. Ms. Schanker also regularly advises accountants, financial advisors, and insurance advisors in connection with her areas of expertise. She has also been a featured speaker for the New York County Lawyers’ Association. Andrea lives in Huntington with her husband, Michael Abruzzo and their daughters, Patricia Gertrude Abruzzo and Sylvia Grace Abruzzo.

 

Jim Aronson, a CERTIFIED FINANCIAL PLANNER® professional, has worked in the estate planning area and with insurance products for over 42 years. He began his career at age 14 working with his father, a Mass Mutual top national producer. Jim joined Crown Life Brokerage after college and was the first Brokerage Manager for Crown Life in the country. He was named a Vice President of Sales for Crown Life Brokerage Associates, which later merged into Ward Financial Group, a founding partner of the R.E. Lee Group. Jim left the R.E. Group in 1999 and founded Insurance Designs Corporation, LLC to work as a General Agent with various top life insurance companies. He was the primary national General Agent for the Advest, Inc., a broker/dealer. Jim’s activities include wholesaling insurance among independent producers, accountants, pension administrators, and financial analysts. He specializes in working with family offices, medical and financially difficult cases, analyzing existing life insurance programs, and developing work out insurance plans for individuals and corporations to redesign premiums and maximize benefits.

 

Please RSVP to Touba Alipour at touba.alipour@rbc.com or Jesus Medina at jesus.medina@rbc.com ,so we can share any research related to the topics discussed during the call.

Event Title: Art viewing and discussion with the National Museum of Women in the Arts on “Seeing Red”

During this webinar we will discuss works including “Portrait of a Noblewoman” by Lavinia Fontana, “Orion” by Alma Woodsey Thomas, and “Shan-Mountain” by Hung Liu. Please join us for an educational webinar to discuss these works and answer your questions.

Event Title: Understanding the Fed and the future of wealth in America
Description: Before the COVID-19 crisis, the disparity between the rich and the poor was at levels not seen since World War II—and the gap has widened during the pandemic. For this educational webinar, we will be joined by Karen Petrou, author of "Engine of Inequality" and Co-Founder & Managing Partner of Federal Financial Analytics. During the webinar, Petrou will share her insider’s look at how the Federal Reserve drives economic inequality and a pragmatic playbook for a more equitable central bank. Please reach out to Brian Carson to RSVP.

Event Title: Broadway During Covid-19 by Wendy Federman, Theatre & Film Producer
Description:
In light of the continuing turmoil in the world, we are hosting a conference call on Thursday 04/29/2021 at 4:30 PM (EST) with Wendy Federman, Theatre & Film Producer. The purpose of the call is to discuss Broadway During the Covid-19 pandemic.

 

Wendy Federman is a nine-time Tony Award winning theatre and film producer. She has also received two Olivier Awards, ten Drama Desk Awards, eighteen Outer Critics Circle Awards, sixteen Drama League Awards, and a GLADD Media Award for many of her nearly ninety co-productions. Wendy has a tremendous commitment to the theater arts and the generosity of her time is evident in her numerous philanthropic causes related to her profession. Wendy has served as guest lecturer for many charitable foundations and spent countless hours throughout her career mentoring aspiring producers, actors and writers. Wendy co-founded an annual fund-raising event, “Broadway’s Got Guts,” which directly benefits the Crohn’s & Colitis Foundation.

 

Wendy is the chair of the Nominating Committee and also serves as co-chair of the annual Chita Rivera Awards event which celebrates the superb achievements of the top dancers and choreographers on Broadway and in film. Wendy serves as Advisor for unique works of entertainment including Particle Ink, a new live immersive theater experience and mobile-app virtual game utilizing augmented reality (AR), a mixed reality and game-changing technology that alters the physical world you see and experience. In addition, Wendy is a proud member of the John F. Kennedy Center’s National Committee for the Performing Arts. Wendy received the 2020 Award of Excellence from the Capital Speakers Club of Washington, D.C. in recognition of her notable artistic achievements as a multiple Tony Award winning theatre producer, for her talent, creativity, and inspiration to women in her field. She was also a 2019 recipient of the Ellis Island Medal of Honor which is awarded to 100 Americans whose accomplishments in their field and inspired service to our nation are worthy of commendation. Wendy has also served as trustee on several significant boards including The Foundation for Gender Equality, Bergen Performing Arts Center, MCC Theater, Gilda’s Club and Penguin Repertory Theater.

Description:

Rob is a tax partner in the firm’s Financial Sponsors & Financial Services Industry Practice. Based in New York, Rob specializes in the investment management industry where he serves both offshore and domestic investment entities. He provides services to alternative investment funds, such as private equity funds, venture capital funds, fund-of-funds, hedge funds, and family offices. In addition to tax compliance services, Rob advises clients on the structure of portfolio transactions, international tax planning, and the internal structure of both fund and management entities to maximize tax efficiency. Rob is a regular speaker at industry and firm events, and has published articles on tax issues that affect investment partnerships

Prior to joining Cohn Reznick, Rob worked for a large investment bank and a regional accounting firm where he served middle market clients in a variety of industries.

Description:

The purpose of the call is to discuss the equity markets and inflation during the pandemic.

 

ClearBridge Investments is a leading global equity manager committed to delivering long-term results through active management and has been in business for over 50 years. ClearBridge Investments has $184 billion in assets under management as of 3/31/2021.

 

Josh is an Investment Strategy Analyst and conducts research to help frame the firm’s macro and market outlook for internal and external constituents. Josh joined ClearBridge Investments in 2017 and has 12 years of investment industry experience. Prior to joining ClearBridge, Josh was an Assistant Vice President, Associate Strategist covering U.S. Equity at RBC Capital Markets and an Assistant Vice President, Client Portfolio Analyst at Bessemer Trust. He received a BA in Government from Colby College. He is a member of the CFA Institute.

 

Kevin Golden began his career in financial services in 1997 and joined Franklin Templeton in 2007. Prior to joining Franklin Templeton, he spent 10 years at Oppenheimer Funds, Pershing and New York Life. As an advisor to financial professionals, Kevin provides a valuable perspective in the areas of market insights, practice management, and portfolio construction. He consults with financial professionals to help them deliver better outcomes for their clients and grow their business. Kevin has a wealth of industry knowledge and a deep understanding of Franklin Templeton investment solutions including mutual funds, ETFs, separately managed accounts, model portfolios, 529 plans and insurance products.

Event Title: Creating your own top tier blend of wine from vineyards around the world by Michael Evans, Co-founder, The Vines of Mendoza
Description:
We are hosting a conference call on Thursday 05/20/2021 at 4:30 PM (EST) with Michael Evans, Co-founder, The Vines of Mendoza. The purpose of the call is to discuss bringing the dream of owning a vineyard and making your very own premium quality wine to reality.

In 2005, Michael went on what he thought would be a three-week vacation to Argentina. Falling in love with the Mendoza wine region, he co-founded (with Pablo Gimenez-Riili) The Vines of Mendoza. Their idea was to allow people who are passionate about wine to own small vineyards and transform themselves into winemakers. They now have over 230 vineyard owners, more than 170 award-winning wines, and the celebrated Vines Resort & Spa (ranked as the best hotel in Argentina and #25 in the world by Travel & Leisure). The Vines of Mendoza has become a unique community of winemakers who share a sense of adventure and the belief that “nada es imposible”.

Now Michael, as CEO also of The Vines, is leading the expansion efforts, creating a global membership network of vineyards and wineries, which will enable wine lovers to become winemakers in 12 iconic wine regions throughout the world. Michael’s personal wines are called Uco’s Playground, after his black Lab, Maria Uco, who has been his constant companion in this wine adventure at the foot of the Andes.

Event Title: Power Hour: Social Security and Medicare - All You Need to Know
Description:
A properly planned Social Security benefit can be worth over $1.25 million. A wrong move in Social Security benefits can cost you almost half that.

Help protect yourself from making the wrong move and learn what you need to know about Medicare.

  • Will Social Security be there for you and what will it look like?
  • Learn the Ins & Outs of how Social Security works given various life situations
  • Learn why anyone over 65 has a special SS advantage
  • Learn advanced strategies to help optimize your or your parent’s lifetime cumulative benefit
  • Understand Part A, B, C, & D of Medicare
  • When and how to apply for Medicare

Ladies, we are living longer, earning more and inheriting more. Get the 4-1-1 to help you be savvy and prepared for your and your family’s financial success. We’ll review key considerations for your aging parents, children and yourself, as well as action you can take today in preparation for potential financial hurdles in the future.

Event Title: Cyber Security: Identify and Protect Your Data
Description:
Please join The Kroneberger Group and Adam Evans for an informative session that will provide you with critical information to help you build trust and confidence when interacting online. Key takeaways include:

  • How Hackers Attack
  • Current and Common scams
  • Cybersecurity during COVID-19
  • Best Practices for protecting yourself
  • Protecting your business

Hosted by: The Kroneberger Group                                                                     

Guest speaker: Adam Evans, Vice President, Cyber Operations and Chief Information Security Officer at RBC

 

Please submit questions in advance to Gina Steele (gina.steele@rbc.com) or Christine Buckley (Christine.buckley@rbc.com).

Hub: Personal Wealth Management Montalto Weil Bird
Event Title: Register Now: Personal Wealth Management Montalto Weil Bird Team Webinar - Understanding Medicare from A to D
Description:
Understanding Medicare from A to D

June 2021 | Hosted by your Personal Wealth Management Montalto Weil Bird Team

Presented by Leonardo Vittini – Sales Director | First Eagle Investment Management, LLC.

 

Please join us on Tuesday, June 22nd at 4:00PM EST for an informative webinar on Medicare:

 

An aging US population means that an increasing number of Americans will qualify for Medicare each year. Many Americans will likely need direction through what can be a complicated and confusing process. Medicare is key to affordable health care access for most Americans, and the benefits it provides should be factored into any comprehensive investment planning strategy. Our informative webinar can help guide you through the essentials of Medicare, including:

Topics:

  • Introduction to Medicare, its coverage and its costs
  • The enrollment process, and where/how to start
  • Coordinating Medicare benefits with other forms of insurance
  • The resources available to help individuals

Date: Tuesday, June 22nd

Time: 4:00PM Eastern

Hosted by: Your Personal Wealth Management Montalto Weil Bird Team and Leonardo Vittini, First Eagle Investment Management

Join Here: Register Now

 

Note: Once you register with your name and email – a follow-up email will be sent to you with a join meeting link and a meeting password. Please save this email and use the “Join Meeting” link at the time of the webinar to connect.

 

If you are interested in joining our webinar, please RSVP now using the “Register Now” link located above.

Description: Join us for our next Know More, Save More webinar: Saving and Paying for College. Event Title: Social Security: The Choice of a Lifetime
Description:
Learn about the Nationwide Retirement Institute Social Security 360® program that offers an end-to-end solution that combines education on Social Security, a suite of materials, a comprehensive tool for guiding well-informed filing decisions and broad support for answering commonly asked questions and developing income plans.

Hosted by: Bosart Wealth Management Group

About our speaker:

David Harris joined Nationwide in 1997 and is currently a Vice President with the Nationwide Retirement Institute. In his role Dave is dedicated to educating on the latest in retirement income solutions. He annually addresses thousands of financial professionals and participants, and his sessions are carefully customized to meet the needs of each group.

 

 

Securities offered through RBC Wealth Management. RBC Wealth Management is not affiliated with Nationwide Retirement Institute.

Event Title: Ten things to know about the market mid-year
Description:
Please join us for an update and ten things to know about the market at mid-year. Vaccine progress, continued fiscal support from Washington and pent-up consumer demand are bolstering the economic recovery. The strengthening recovery appears to be broadening across the United States and some countries in the second half of 2021. 

Guest speaker: Lindsay Strickland - Senior Portfolio Advisor

This is a virtual presentation hosted by the Washington DC Complex of RBC Wealth Management. Please contact our office at hagerstownbranch@rbc.com for more information.

Event Title: Lunch 'N Learn: Will Tax Hikes Kill the Bull Market?
Description: With the Biden administration acknowledging plans to potentially raise taxes, what impact will it have on the market? Please join us to hear from Invesco's Global Market Strategist, Brian Levitt, to review details of the administration's plan, historical perspectives on different tax regimes and the implications of tax increases on the economy.

Event Title: Lunch 'n Learn: 2021 Mid-Year Market Update and Outlook
Description: 2021 has been different than what many of us expected this time last year. In this session, Dan will discuss the factors that led us to where we are now and will give us his outlook on the economy and stock market, as well as risks and opportunities as the world emerges from the COVID-19 pandemic.

Our next Quarterly Market Update call will be held on Friday, July 30th, at 4p CT.

The agenda for this call will include:

1. PSO Group Operational Update

2. Market Update – Month, Quarter, and Year

3. Economic Outlook – A Forward Look at Risks vs. Opportunities

Please RSVP below to join the conversation!

We are thrilled to share that this year’s RBC “Race for the Kids” Seattle event will be an in-person, family-friendly gathering on Sunday, August 8th from 10am - noon at Magnuson Park!

The RBC Race for the Kids series started as a single event in 2009 and has grown to 17 locations, raising over $45 million dollars to date for children’s charities around the globe.

In Seattle, we are proud to support Boyer Children’s Clinic and the amazing work they do in our community.

Event Title: Base Camp: Hanford Pension Options - Annuity vs Lump Sum
Description:
If you are a Hanford area worker, or know someone who is, this virtual event is for you!

Many people on the verge of retirement are wondering which pension option may be best for them. With so many choices such as straight life annuity, joint and survivor, period certain and lump sum, choosing a pension option can be a daunting task!

This virtual event will help provide important information so that you can make the best choice with your pension for your retirement life plan.

Should you, or someone you know, have questions about their pension, or which option to take, this event on September 16th will be a great place to start to learn more information this decision.

 

Join as we cover this topic via a LIVE virtual WebEx link.

Please RSVP by email using the link below.

We will email you a link to join the WebEx presentation prior to the start of the event.

Event Title: 2021 Know more. Save more. Series: Retirement Readiness Workshop
Description: Are you ready to retire? Alisha Wesser, CFP® and Wes Previant, CFP® will be discussing the hot topics and critical checklist necessary to make sure that you financial plan for retirement can withstand the volatility of the stock market.

Event Title: 2021 Know more. Save more. Series: Medicare & Its Impact to my Retirement
Description: Alisha Wesser, CFP® and Wes Previant, CFP® will be discussing the impact of Medicare which helps fund one of the largest expenses in retirement. Learn about your options and how it might change your plans for retirement.

Event Title: The convergence of health care and financial planning
Description:
Please join The Etergino Group and Bedrock Business Results for a discussion on the convergence of health care and financial planning.

Health care costs have emerged as a major concern for personal financial planning, especially for those nearing retirement. During this webinar, we will learn how to build a realistic cost estimate, how to evaluate the different Medicare options and how preretirement, tax-efficient wealth accumulation strategies can lower health care costs.

We will be joined by Peter Stahl of Bedrock Business Results.

Please reach out to Christine Pisano to RSVP.

Our team, the Tactical Planning Group, is excited to announce the start of our upcoming Monthly Webinar Series. Each Webinar will be held on the 2nd Tuesday of every month at 12PM EST and will last for approximately 30 minutes. These webinars will feature a variety of Wealth Planning topics that we hope you will find informative and insightful.

On Tuesday, September 14th at 12PM EST we will invite Wealth Strategist, Les Williams, to discuss Estate Planning Essential services: Wills, Trusts and Probate.

• Our latest thoughts and outlook for the global markets
• Opportunities and risks across the different regional markets, including the U.S. markets
• Update on inflation
• Upcoming macro events and their potential influence on the markets

Event Title: Learn more about RBC Wealth Management in this virtual meeting
Description:
The Inter Alia Group is excited to be moving to RBC Wealth Management to better serve you (our clients). We recognize that it is imperative that we give our clients what we believe is the best platform and opportunity to reach their goals. RBC Wealth Management’s global resources, technology and culture can create an experience designed to serve you. As part of this transition, we want you to hear firsthand from the president of RBC Wealth Management, Tom Sagissor. This client-centered organization puts people and communities first! We have set up an opportunity for you to join us and the president for a brief conversation about the bright future we all share.

 

Guest speaker: Tom Sagissor, President, RBC Wealth Management – U.S.

Event Title: Join Us for Johns Hopkins Medicine's A Women's Journey® Webinar
Description:
The Kroneberger Group is proud to sponsor of  Johns Hopkins Medicine's A Woman’s Journey® on November 13, 2021 from 9:45 AM - 12:15 PM ET. Please join us for an Extraordinary Journey for Extraordinary Times. For over 25 years, Johns Hopkins Woman’s Journey has presented the latest developments on topics from heart health to cancer prevention. This year, topics include reducing inflammation through food, memory loss, cosmetic procedures, colon cancer in African-American women, fertility and mental health.

 

More Information

 

If you are interested in joining us, please contact Christine Buckley at christine.buckley@rbc.com for registration information. Registration is limited.

With the upcoming Fall Season, we are excited to announce our Annual Shredding Event is back on the Calendar!  Bring your old Financial Statements, Bills, Pay Stubs, and copies of Tax Returns for secure shredding provided by PROSHRED Security. For more information about the event, please contact our Team at 855-360-VIEW (8439).

*No plastic bags, binders or large plastic binder clips. Documents may not be dropped off prior to the event to be shredded during the event, or given to someone to shred for you.*
Join Griffin Geisler as he shares more information about Social Security and Medicare and key information to know to help you as you plan for the future.

Event Title: Retirement 101 - With James Varnum, Education & Enrollment Specialist with Nationwide
Description: We know that retirement is  as unique as each individual planning for it. That’s why at Nationwide, we define retirement as your vision for the future – not as dollars and benchmarks. Retirement is different for everyone. And because it may seem far away, it’s hard to imagine what it will look like for you. But having some of your biggest questions answered can help you start planning. Please join us to learn more about saving for retirement.

Event Title: Planning For Healthcare Costs in Retirement With David Harris, Vice President with Nationwide Retirement Institute
Description:
Learn about how  healthcare costs can impact your retirement income. Learn what Medicare covers and what costs you pay out-of-pocket.  Learn what planning options you can use to prepare for these expense.

Hosted by: Bosart Wealth Management Group

About our speaker:

David Harris joined Nationwide in 1997 and is currently a Vice President with the Nationwide Retirement Institute. In his role Dave is dedicated to educating on the latest in retirement income solutions. He annually addresses thousands of financial professionals and participants, and his sessions are carefully customized to meet the needs of each group.

Event Title: Know more, save more:  the basics of investing
Description: Join us for the latest in our Know more, save more series of webinars, as we explain the basic building blocks of investing, types of investment accounts, and how investing plays into your long-term goals. Please note: the event password is "401k".

Event Title: A Discussion with Women for Women International on Women and Girls in Afghanistan
Description:
For over 25 years, Women for Women International has provided essential support to women survivors of war and conflict. Its mission is to invest in women’s skills, connections and resources so they may create sustainable change for themselves, their families and their communities.
Afghanistan is currently one of the most difficult countries in the world in which to identify as a woman. During this webinar, Women for Women International will educate us on the current situation for women and girls in Afghanistan, and share with us the ways their organization is supporting Afghan women and helping them discover their power.

Hosted by: The Etergino Group

Guest speaker: Marie Clarke, Vice President for Programs, Women for Women International

 

 

RBC Wealth Management is not affiliated with Women for Women International.

Photo courtesy of Women for Women International.

Event Title: Technology Industry Overview:  "INNOVATION IS EATING THE WORLD"
Description:
Topics: E-commerce, Communication, Software, Semiconductors

Presenting Company: RBC Wealth Management

Presented by Janus Investors, Senior Product Specialist: Michael McNurney

Hosted by: RBC Assistant Branch Director – Christopher Lobo

There is very little doubt that we are witnessing a technology revolution that is impacting consumers and companies not only in the USA but around the world.

Technology has influenced the way we perform our job, enjoy our free time and connect socially.

The RBC Wealth Management Syracuse Branch has organized a conference call on the Technology Industry. The discussion will be focusing on the areas within technology that are currently experiencing strong revenue growth.

Michael will provide a deeper understanding as to why this industry continues to experience strong revenue growth, especially in several key areas of technology: E-Commerce, Communication & Software, Semiconductors, Autonomous Vehicles.

The process to join our call is as follows:

1.) Click on the email below in order to confirm your attendance 

2.) On the day of the conference and a few minutes before the call, simply dial the phone number: 1.800.736.4610

And don’t forget to have the presentation open on your computer or printed out and on your desk.

Description:
Charitable giving can be a powerful way to make an impact and create a legacy. It also offers a financial tool for estate planning and tax management.

During this webinar, we will discuss different charitable giving vehicles, including donor-advised funds, foundations and charitable trusts, and our key strategies for maximizing charitable gifts.

Guest speaker: Cathy Walker, Senior Trust Consultant, RBC Wealth Management

Event Title: How to plan for a successful wealth transfer
Description:
Transferring wealth and assets to future generations may be the ultimate estate planning goal, yet studies have shown it is difficult to achieve. How do you see that your wealth brings value and benefits to future generations? How do you start planning your legacy?

During this webinar, we will share advice on how to plan for a successful wealth transfer, explain the impact of family dynamics, and identify what separates families that are successful from the rest.

The Williams Group is a family wealth coaching firm that helps families navigate wealth transfers as well as complex and evolving circumstances.

Guest Speaker: Amy Castoro, President and CEO of The Williams Group

Event Title: Retirement 101 - With James Varnum, Education & Enrollment Specialist with Nationwide
Description: We know that retirement is as unique as each individual planning for it. That’s why at Nationwide, we define retirement as your vision for the future – not as dollars and benchmarks. Retirement is different for everyone. And because it may seem far away, it’s hard to imagine what it will look like for you. But having some of your biggest questions answered can help you start planning. Please join us to learn more about saving for retirement.

Event Title: Food for thought: how technology is improving food sustainability
Description:
Please join The Etergino Group for a webinar on “Food for thought: how technology is improving food sustainability”

Today’s realities and tomorrow’s challenges are calling for new, technology-driven food production and distribution solutions. At the same time, unpredictable and extreme weather patterns are further complicating the food supply puzzle.

During this webinar, we will look at technologies that offer the promise of feeding a growing global population while limiting the burden on the environment.

Event Title: Join Us for Johns Hopkins Medicine's A Women's Journey® Webinar
Description:
The Kroneberger Group is proud to sponsor of  Johns Hopkins Medicine's A Woman’s Journey® on November 13, 2021 from 9:45 AM - 12:15 PM ET. Please join us for an Extraordinary Journey for Extraordinary Times. For over 25 years, Johns Hopkins Woman’s Journey has presented the latest developments on topics from heart health to cancer prevention. This year, topics include reducing inflammation through food, memory loss, cosmetic procedures, colon cancer in African-American women, fertility and mental health.

Event Title: Base Camp: Hanford Pension Options - Annuity vs Lump Sum
Description:
If you are a Hanford area worker, or know someone who is, this virtual event is for you! 

Many people on the verge of retirement are wondering which pension option may be best for them. With so many choices such as straight life annuity, joint and survivor, period certain and lump sum, choosing a pension option can be a daunting task! 

This virtual event will help provide important information so that you can make the best choice with your pension for your retirement life plan.

Should you, or someone you know, have questions about their pension, or which option to take, this one hour virtual event will be a great place to start learning more information on this decision.

Join as we cover this topic via a LIVE virtual WebEx link.

Please RSVP by email using the link below or send an email to pacificcrestplanning@rbc.com .

We will email you a link to join the WebEx presentation prior to the start of the event.

Event Title: Retirement 101 - With James Varnum, Education & Enrollment Specialist with Nationwide
Description: We know that retirement is as unique as each individual planning for it. That’s why at Nationwide, we define retirement as your vision for the future – not as dollars and benchmarks. Retirement is different for everyone. And because it may seem far away, it’s hard to imagine what it will look like for you. But having some of your biggest questions answered can help you start planning. Please join us to learn more about saving for retirement.

Event Title: Women for Women International on women and girls in Ukraine
Description:
Please join the Etergino Group for a webinar where we will have a discussion with Women for Women International on women and girls in Ukraine.

Millions of refugees have fled Ukraine so far - most of them women and children. For over 25 years, Women for Women International has provided essential support to women survivors of war and conflict.

During this webinar, Women for Women International will update us on the current situation for Ukrainian women and girls, and share with us the ways their organization is providing support.

Event Title: Base Camp: RBC Wealth Management Online Tutorial
Description:
RBC and the Pacific Crest Planning team want to make it easy for you to view your financial accounts on-the-go. Our online account access has been improved and refreshed and we would like to take you through this system to display some key benefits to help you when using this tool.

We will be covering basic features of this system as well as providing tips and tricks on ways to customize and make this system work better for you.

It is suggested that you sign up for Wealth Management Online prior to the start of this event so that if able, you can follow along with us and try the features out on your own during the presentation.

Please join us as we cover this topic to enhance your experience with your RBC Wealth Management Online system.

 

 

Key benefits of Wealth Management Online include:

  • Access your documents including tax, account statements, and trade confirmations

  • Update paperless settings to dictate what documents are mailed

  • View account information on your home computer, tablet, or mobile device

  • See your complete financial picture—including your RBC accounts and those at other financial institutions—through the RBC Total Wealth feature

 

Fast and easy registration

If you're interested in signing up for RBC Wealth Management Online, just call the office, our team can initiate the registration process for you. You will receive an email invitation with a link to register that's valid for seven days. You can make adjustments to your paperless preferences after registering. 

Or, if you prefer, you can also register on your own. Simply gather the account numbers of the RBC Wealth Management accounts you'd like to view online and follow the link below. Then, provide necessary contact and account information, and select your User ID and password. During registration, you can also make paperless elections to receive documents online instead of by mail.

 

REGISTER FOR RBC WEALTH MANAGEMENT ONLINE

 

Join as we cover this topic via a LIVE virtual WebEx link.

We will email you a link to join the WebEx presentation prior to the start of the event.
